intro: Pfaffia cinerea, commonly known as white cohosh, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the genus Pfaffia, which is part of the Araliaceae family. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the summer. Its roots are often harvested for their medicinal properties, which have been traditionally used in herbal medicine. Pfaffia cinerea thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
